brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are testing two over the counter aloe veras on irradiated breast tissue.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aloe Vera on Irradiated Breast Tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Women over 18 years of age who had undergone lumpectomy or partial mastectomy for
             breast cancer, and who then received postoperative radiation therapy using tangential
             fields, with or without a boost to the tumor bed. Chemotherapy as part of the
             treatment regimen was acceptable.

          2. No major medical or psychiatric illness that might interfere with patient's
             completion of study requirements

          3. Signed study-specific informed consent form prior to study entry

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Those requiring nodal radiation therapy were excluded.

          2. Subjects who have a breast infection at the commencement of radiation treatment

          3. Before randomization, subjects who have agreed to participate are asked if they are
             allergic to any topical preparation. Those allergic to aloe vera were ineligible.

intervention.intervention_name: Klean & Klear  The Dandy Day Corp
The Skin Gel   Herbal Answers, Inc

facility.name: Lewis Hall Singletary Oncology Center at John D. Archbold Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Double Blind Study on the Efficacy of Topical Aloe Vera Gel on Irradiated Breast Tissue

primary_outcome.description: since we are testing two over the counter products we wanted to wee if one tested better than the other

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: is there a difference in itching

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
